Dear Ms. Sheppard:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
June 14, 2022. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
The facility is non-contracted, therefore, MISEP requirements are not applicable.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
The facility is not a local MDHHS office nor does the facility have a MDHHS contract,
therefore, MDHHS policy/MDHHS contract are not applicable.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
The facility was not in need of technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted one acceptable corrective action plan in response to the
renewal inspection completed on 5/19/2021 with a corrective action plan approved
on 6/11/2021. During the review the agency had one violation. No citations were
noted as repeat violations in the current inspection. During this period under review
the agency expressed there were no barriers that impacted overall compliance.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The assessment reported no barriers that impacted the overall compliance during
this review period. The Chief Administrator (CA) stated the previous year CAP was
effective and has had a positive impact on all charts and procedures. The CA stated
the agency has implemented quarterly chart audit reviews to ensure all
documentation is completed thoroughly. The CA expressed confidence the agency
will continue overall compliance over the next review period.
4

Interviews
Interviews were conducted with three staff via telephone. Staff hope to see
expansion of agency programs, increased housing options for youth, and increased
staff recruitment efforts. Overall, staff reported feeling supported by supervision, as
well as having supervisors available when needed. In addition, staff reported
coworkers are always willing to help each other when needed.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
___________6/17/2022__________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
